Malandriner Links

Una colección curada de enlaces para ayudarte en el desarrollo web con recursos de Web Reactiva y La Selecta Newsletter

Este es un proyecto de Antonio Arjona

Enlaces disponibles bajo “Full Malandriner”

Estás viendo enlaces desde la categoría “Full Malandriner”. Volver a categorías.

  • @Chemistdev

    Quality Engineer & Software Developer for Web Appications

  • BritCo courses

    Use code SELFCARE to access any courses for free on subjects like design, lettering, photography, and coding.

  • Codewars

    An intensive challenge for all levels of coders.

  • Coding4Kids @Home Program

    As the COVID-19 Pandemic spreads and more and more of our children are homebound, parents are looking for productive and meaningful things for our kids to do.

  • Crash Course

    YouTube videos on many subjects.

  • Every Layout

    Learn CSS by distilling common layout problems into resilient, flexible layout solutions.

  • Flexbox Zombies

    Learn CSS flexbox by defeating zombies.

  • Futurelearn

    Free to access 100s of courses, only pay to upgrade if you need a certificate in your name (own account from age 14+ but younger learners can use a parent account).

  • Hack Club

    Online community of high school hackers & makers around the world, & network of student-led coding clubs.

  • Kano Computer Kit

    Kano invented the first make-your-own computer for all ages, the Kano Computer Kit, in 2014. Make a computer, learn to code, play.

  • Learn JavaScript

    JavaScript lessons that unlock flash cards for further study.

  • Learn Programming

    Teaches programming concepts for absolute beginners with flashcards, fill in the blank and challenges.

  • Lumen Open Ed Resources

    College-level community-developed OER texts/courses covering a range of subjects, including science, history and literature.

  • National Geographic Kids

    Activities and quizzes for younger kids.

  • Open Culture courses

    Large collection of courses, lectures, degree programs, and certifications.

  • Openlearn

    Free taster courses aimed at those considering Open University but everyone can access it. Adult level, but some e.g. nature and environment courses could well be of interest to young people.

  • Pluralsight

    Online learning courses in a variety of technical fields. Free for the month of April!

  • Radiolab for Kids

    Kid-friendly stories curated by Radiolab (the popular NY Public Radio podcast)

  • Seneca

    For those revising at GCSE or A level. Tons of free revision content. Paid access to higher level material.

  • Ted Ed

    All sorts of engaging educational videos.

  • The Odin Project

    Free full stack curriculum supported by a passionate open source community.

  • Virtual School Day by Varsity Tutors

    20+ hours of free live, online instruction each week led by expert instructors with experience in the course topic, as well as familiarity with virtual instruction. Classes refresh weekly, with age-appropriate options for grades K-12.

  • WarriorJS

    Educational online JavaScript game. Code your way through dungeons, prove your skills.

Volver a la lista

Un proyecto de Antonio Arjona, con mención especial a Web Reactiva por proveer esta coleccion de links. Este sitio esta creado con Eleventy y alojado en Netlify.
